missed.title: JWT Token IDOR
missed.reason: The expected finding describes JWT tokens being decoded without signature verification, allowing user_id manipulation for unauthorized access to other user accounts. While actual findings include JWT vulnerabilities (missing HttpOnly flag, predictable token generation) and IDOR vulnerabilities (password reset endpoint), none specifically address the scenario of JWT signature verification being bypassed to allow user_id manipulation via JWT token modification. The IDOR vulnerability found is in the password reset endpoint via POST parameters, not in JWT token handling.

extra.title: Missing CSRF Protection on Logout Endpoint
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate security finding - the logout endpoint lacks CSRF protection, allowing attackers to force users to logout via CSRF attacks.

extra.title: User Enumeration via Error Message Differentiation
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate security finding - the application reveals whether usernames exist through different HTTP response codes and error messages, enabling user enumeration attacks.

extra.title: Critical IDOR Vulnerability - Unauthorized Password Reset via user_id Parameter Manipulation
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate security finding - the password reset endpoint lacks authorization checks, allowing users to change other users' passwords via user_id parameter manipulation combined with SQL injection vulnerabilities.

extra.title: Server Information Disclosure via HTTP Headers
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate security finding - the Server header exposes Apache version (2.4.65) and OS (Debian), facilitating targeted CVE exploitation.

extra.title: Missing Security Headers (Clickjacking Protection)
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate security finding - missing X-Frame-Options, CSP, X-Content-Type-Options, and X-XSS-Protection headers increase vulnerability to clickjacking and XSS attacks.

extra.title: Absence of Brute Force Protection on Password Authentication
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate security finding - no rate limiting or account lockout mechanisms exist, allowing brute force attacks at 50+ attempts per second.

extra.title: Insecure JWT Cookie - Missing HttpOnly Flag
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate security finding - the JWT auth_token cookie lacks HttpOnly, Secure, and SameSite flags, making it vulnerable to XSS, MITM, and CSRF attacks.

extra.title: Hardcoded Test Account Credentials (test:test) Allowing Unauthorized Access
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate security finding - a test account with credentials test:test exists in production, providing direct unauthorized access to the trading platform.

extra.title: Default Credentials test:test Accessible in Production
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate security finding - test credentials documented in HTML comments remain active in production, enabling complete authentication bypass.

extra.title: Improper Cache-Control Header on Authenticated Pages
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate security finding - authenticated pages use 'Cache-Control: public' instead of 'private', potentially allowing shared caches to serve sensitive authenticated content to other users.

extra.title: Predictable Session Generation - Identical Tokens on Repeated Logins
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate security finding - JWT tokens are identical on repeated logins for the same user, with no random values or timestamps, enabling token precomputation and complete authentication bypass.

extra.title: User ID Information Disclosure in Password Form
extra.location: Password entry form after username submission
extra.assessment: This is a legitimate security finding - user_id values are exposed in hidden form fields, enabling user enumeration and providing critical identifiers for IDOR attacks.
